JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Program manager (specialkonsulent) for the Program for Translational Hematology (PTH) (KU) / Finsenlab, BRIC
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Faculty of Health and Medical Sciences
University of Copenhagen

We are looking for a highly motivated and independent program manager to commence 1 August 2022 and will end at 31 December 2024.

Our research
The Program for Translational Hematology (PTH) is a collaborative interdisciplinary translational research program at Finsenlab/BRIC and Rigshospitalet, established to gain fundamental understanding of hematological malignancies such as acute myeloid leukemia (AML) and myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS).

Within PTH we have both academic and clinical research groups as well as core activities including biobanking, drug screening, and sequencing. These core functions are used by the research groups within PTH in a collaborative effort to gain understanding of the diseases studied on an individual patient level and to identify novel therapeutic opportunities.

Your job
As program manager for the PTH you will be part of the research administration for the program and have a central role in coordinating activities between the different research groups and the interdisciplinary team of core staff members. You will take part in planning, implementing and coordinating new procedures and other activities within the PTH. You will work closely with both PTH PIs and researchers and serve as a communication link between the two, implementing new strategies with a problem-solving mindset.

Profile
We are looking for a highly motivated and enthusiastic scientist with the following competencies and experience:

Specific requirements:

  • A Phd in life science
  • Experience working within the field of hematology, specifically AML or MDS
  • Project management experience
  • Experience with flow cytometry
  • Experience with GDPR and ethical permits
You are also expected to have the following personal qualifications:

  • Open and service-minded attitude
  • Good interpersonal communication skills
  • Good English skills, written and spoken
Place of employment
The place of employment is at Finsenlab/BRIC, University of Copenhagen. We offer creative and stimulating working conditions in dynamic and international research environment. Our research facilities include modern laboratories and core facilities.

Terms of salary and employment
The employment as program manager (specialkonsulent) (AC-TAP) is a full time and fixed-term position for 2 years. Starting date is 1 August 2022. Employment will be in accordance with the provisions of the collective agreement between the Danish Ministry of Finance and AC (the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations). The monthly salary will be based on the number of years of work experience (seniority) with the possibility to negotiate a salary supplement based on prior experiences and qualifications. The employer will pay an additional 17.1 % to your pension fund.

Questions
For further information regarding the position, please contact Prof. Bo Porse; bo.porse@finsenlab.dk.

Application
Your application should be in English and include:

  • Letter of application addressing the requirements (max. one page).
  • Curriculum Vitae
  • A certified/signed copy of certificate(s) of education
Please submit your application by clicking on “Apply Now” below. Only online applications will be accepted.

Application deadline: 10 May 2022.

We reserve the right not to consider material received after the deadline, and not to consider applications that do not live up to the abovementioned requirements.

Interviews are expected to be held in week of May 30, 2022

The University of Copenhagen wish to reflect the diversity of society and encourage all qualified candidates to apply regardless of personal background
